description: FANCY is a fasttool for estimation for of privacy risk in functional genomics data.
name: FANCY

metadata.abstract: © 2020 The Author(s) 2020. Published by Oxford University Press.Motivation: Functional genomics data are becoming clinically actionable, raising privacy concerns. However, quantifying privacy leakage via genotyping is difficult due to the heterogeneous nature of sequencing techniques. Thus, we present FANCY, a tool that rapidly estimates the number of leaking variants from raw RNA-Seq, ATAC-Seq and ChIP-Seq reads, without explicit genotyping. FANCY employs supervised regression using overall sequencing statistics as features and provides an estimate of the overall privacy risk before data release. Results: FANCY can predict the cumulative number of leaking SNVs with an average 0.95 R2 for all independent test sets. We realize the importance of accurate prediction when the number of leaked variants is low. Thus, we develop a special version of the model, which can make predictions with higher accuracy when the number of leaking variants is low.
metadata.title: FANCY: Fast estimation of privacy risk in functional genomics data
